participants.name: Carine Dieude
participants.title: Partner. Entrepreneurship Aficionado. Girls In Tech PHX

messages.message:
Hello Brian

Thank you for the LinkedIn connection and nice to meet you electronically. I make a point to know my connections. What do you specialize in? 

My focus is to take businesses from what's now to what's next. We are a business accelerator firm providing access to capital, financial, strategy, sales and accountability services. 

I am a fervent practionner of the 6 degrees of separation theory. It's surprising who people know. How can I help?

Carine Dieudé | Partner – Altima Business Solutions

Thank you for the executive summary Carine.

I am a software developer who has been working on an EdTech company for the last 3 years. We hit a stopping point waiting on Great Hearts to make a financial commitment. My partner and owner of the company has approached investors before but sounded like he wants to make it on his own until we have a success product with at least one school system. I had to go an get another full time job since we don't want to spend a bunch of time on features until we know it works.

I think with social networks we are down to 3 degrees of Kevin Bacon.

I am applying my skills to some new projects now as this is my first time in true corporate America. It is amazing how slowly things move compared to Lean Startups. I am trying to learn how the overall vision of a long term company makes it in front of their customers.

We have a little Airbnb business, my wife is an artist and painter going to school for cosmetology and aesthetics. I have a side gig setting up a new marketing site for thesosmethod.com. Lots of irons in the fire but I don't see a way to make my ideas a global resource and live off of it so in the meantime I am trying to learn as much as possible.

As it turns out, I still get to do whatever I want in corporate America, I just have to convince 3 extra managers first ;)

I am a happy corporate drop out so I can relate! The lean startup methodology is a great framework. Unfortunately it has been dissolved and now the ecosystem experiences a huge gap. That's one of my favorite talks: From MVP to VC. I'll be speaking at Phoenix Startup Week in February. You may want to check it out :-) 
It's always the same conundrum with starting a business: limited resources, limited skills, limited plans = limited results. Strategic and intentional actions are game changers.
Best wishes in your endeavor. Let me know if I can help.

I wish you and your family a wonderful new year!
Carine
